abstract: National Park Service is evaluating options for restoration and expansion of 52-acre Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park in once-booming industrial city of Paterson, NJ; one plan under consideration would use natural landscape, which includes Paterson Great Falls, to expand outdoor recreation opportunities for city's residents; second approach would focus on giving visitors an immersive understanding of city's historic role in American industrial growth.

headline.print_headline: Park Ponders 2 Paths: A Natural Wonder or a Historical Site?
headline.main: National Park in Paterson, N.J., Ponders 2 Paths: Natural Wonder or Historical Site?

keywords.value: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
keywords.name: glocations

snippet: Rival plans have emerged for the Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park. One emphasizes its natural beauty, the other its role as an early industrial powerhouse.
lead_paragraph: Rival plans have emerged for the Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park. One emphasizes its natural beauty, the other its role as an early industrial powerhouse.
